intro: Curanga torenioides, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asphodelaceae and is characterized by its tall, grass-like stems and narrow, strap-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white flowers that bloom in spring. It is often found in coastal and inland areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and historical significance, it is cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
